paper_abstract: Spiking neural P systems are a class of distributed parallel computing models inspired from the way the neurons communicate with each other by means of electrical impulses (called "spikes"). In this paper, we consider a restricted variant of spiking neural P systems, called homogeneous spiking neural P systems, where each neuron has the same set of rules. The universality of homogeneous spiking neural P systems is investigated. One of universality results is that it is sufficient for homogeneous spiking neural P system to have only one neuron that behaves non-deterministically in order to achieve Turing completeness.
